org.azeckoski.reflectutils.converters.api
Interface Converter<T>

All Superinterfaces:
BaseConverter
All Known Subinterfaces:
InterfaceConverter<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
BigDecimalConverter, BigIntegerConverter, BooleanConverter, ByteConverter, CalendarConverter, CharacterConverter, ClassConverter, CollectionConverter, DateConverter, DoubleConverter, EnumConverter, FileConverter, FloatConverter, IntegerConverter, LongConverter, MapConverter, NumberConverter, ShortConverter, SQLDateConverter, SQLTimeConverter, StringConverter, TimestampConverter, URLConverter
public interface Converter<T>
extends BaseConverter

General converter interface written to specifically be compatible with the commons beanutils one
Allows for conversion between types that is more complete than the current ones
To use this, implement the interface with the type that you care about and then register it with the ConversionUtils by calling ConversionUtils.addConverter(Class, Converter) or you can use the constructor (the method is recommended though)

Method Summary
 T convert(Object value)
          Convert the specified input object into an output object of the type for this converter implementation
 

Method Detail

convert

T convert(Object value)
Convert the specified input object into an output object of the type for this converter implementation

Parameters:
value - the input value to be converted, this will never be null or the type which you are converting to since these simple cases are already handled in the ConversionUtils
Returns:
the converted value (can be null if desired)
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - if conversion cannot be performed successfully
